intro: Jacquinia sak-lol, commonly known as the mountain bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are lanceolate and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often woody at the base. Jacquinia sak-lol is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in alpine gardens.
